nav.div: Sapulpa Public Schools » News » District Headlines » Free meals during closure

div.div: Free meals for children to be served at Holmes Park

div.img:
(SPS) - Sapulpa Public Schools is offering free meals to children during the mandatory closure of schools.
The drive-through curbside service will be available Monday through Friday at Holmes Park Elementary between 10 a.m. and 12 p.m. beginning March 23rd. Patrons should come from the east to access the bus loop off of Adams Street to receive the meals. If you're traveling from Mission, turn east onto McLeod and follow it to Watchorn. Turn south. When you come to Dewey, go west to Adams and turn north.
No one, other than cafeteria staff, will be allowed inside the building. Sapulpa Public Schools employees will be outside to serve children in order to practice proper social distancing guidelines as well as following recommendations of limiting gatherings to fewer than 10 people.
Children will receive both a breakfast and a lunch upon their arrival. Holmes Park Elementary is located at 1231 E. Dewey.
Children do not need to be present in the vehicle, however, we do need to account for each meal. Parents will be asked to provide the first and last name of each child receiving meals that day. Please be aware that writing down the names will slow down the process, so we appreciate your patience.
For more information about the school closure you can visit our Frequently Asked Questions page.

div.span: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
